lines.content: Duke is a chatbot designed to keep track of all your tasks via a Command Line Interface (CLI). This user guide will help you get acquainted with the usage of this tool.
In the same directory as 'ip.jar', enter 'java -jar ip.jar' in a terminal to run Duke. If successful, Duke will appear as such on startup:
***Please follow the format of the given commands exactly to ensure correct operation of Duke.***
Duke supports 3 types of tasks: Todo, Event, Deadline.
A Todo is a simple task without a time constraint. It can be added using the command:
An Event is a task that occurs at a specific time. It can be added using the command:
A Deadline is a task that must be completed by a specific time. It can be added using the command:
All tasks stored by Duke can be printed using the command `list`
Any task that is stored by Duke can be marked complete by calling the command:
Please do not attempt to mark a task as done if it is not stored by Duke.
Any task that is stored by Duke can be deleted by calling the command:
Please do not attempt to delete a task if it is not stored by Duke.
Given a query phrase, Duke can filter and print the stored tasks whose descriptions contain the query phrase. This can be achieved by calling the command:
Duke can be closed by entering the command: `bye`
*Any changes made to the stored tasks are written to file, retaining task progress even when Duke is closed. Pre-existing tasks are reloaded into Duke upon restarting the application.*
* Deadline class that is a type of Task.
* @param description Details of a Deadline object.
* @param by          Finishing time of the Deadline object.
* Returns a String object representing the Deadline.
* @return The String representation of the Deadline.
* Returns a String object representing the Deadline in a format that can be used to read and write
* @return The String representation of the Deadline that be used to read and write from/to file.
* Duke class acts as the main class of the program.
* Entry point of program upon startup.
* Event class that is a type of Task.
* @param description Details of an Event object.
* @param at          Finishing time of the Event object.
* Returns a String object representing the Event.
* @return The String representation of the Event.
* Returns a String object representing the Event in a format that can be used to read and write
* @return The String representation of the Event that be used to read and write from/to file.
* Parser class interprets the user's command.
* Parses the input command given by the user to determine which functionality to execute.
* @param input String entered by the user, denoting instructions for the program.
* Attempts the store feature on the given user input. If the input does not correspond to todo, deadline or event,
* a DukeException is caught. This signifies a wrong input command or an incomplete description of the given task.
* @param input Input command given by the user
Ui.echo("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
Ui.echo("OOPS!!! The description of a task cannot be empty.");
* Storage class facilitates loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file.
* @throws FileNotFoundException If the file at STORED_PATH does not exist.
private static void loadStoredTasks(File storedTasks) throws FileNotFoundException {
System.out.println(STORAGE_PATH + " is corrupted. Please delete duke.txt and restart the program.");
* Loads pre-existing tasks from file at STORAGE_PATH or creates a new file if it does not exist.
System.out.println("An error in reading " + STORAGE_PATH + " occurred.");
System.out.println("An error in creating " + STORAGE_PATH + " occurred.");
* Overwrites the file at STORAGE_PATH with the tasks from the inputTasks list in the TaskList class.
System.out.println(STORAGE_PATH + " can't be overwritten. Changes will be lost when the program is closed");
* Appends a new task to the file at STORAGE_PATH.
* @param newTask Task to append to the file at STORAGE_PATH.
System.out.println(STORAGE_PATH + " cannot be updated. Changes will be lost when the program is closed");
* Task abstract class to be the parent of Event, Deadline, Todo classes
* @param inputTask String description of a Task
* Sets a Task to be completed
* Returns a String object representing the Task in a format that can be used to read and write
* the Task from/to file. It is overridden for each child of the Task class.
* @return The String representation of the Task that be used to read and write from/to file.
* TaskList class contains and facilitate operations on the inputTasks.
private static ArrayList<Task> inputTasks = new ArrayList<>();
* Parses a given input String and stores it as a new task corresponding to todo/event/deadline.
* @param input              Command entered by the user.
* @param shouldAppendToFile Flag to indicate whether the parsed task should be appended to file.
* @throws DukeException If neither todo, deadline or event correspond to the input String.
public static void storeTask(String input, boolean shouldAppendToFile) throws DukeException {
acknowledgeMessage = "Got it. I've added this task: \n  " + inputTasks.get(inputTasks.size() - 1) + "\n"
+ "Now you have: " + inputTasks.size() + " tasks in the list";
* Deletes a task from the list inputTasks based on its index.
* @param taskNumber Index of the task in inputTasks to be deleted.
acknowledgeMessage = "Noted. I've removed this task: \n" + inputTasks.get(taskIndex) + "\n"
+ "Now you have: " + (inputTasks.size() - 1) + " tasks in the list";
Ui.echo("Please enter a task number from the list");
* Prints all tasks in inputTasks that contain a given query String in their descriptions
* @param query Substring to search for within each task's description
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Marks a pre-existing task in the inputTasks list as completed.
* @param completedTask     Index of the task in inputTasks to be marked as complete.
* @param shouldWriteToFile Flag indicating whether the updated inputTasks list should be written to file.
public static void markComplete(int completedTask, boolean shouldWriteToFile) {
Ui.echo("Nice! I've marked this task as done: \n" + inputTasks.get(completedTask - 1));
Ui.echo("Please enter a task number from the list");
* Todo class that is a type of Task.
* @param description Details of a Todo object.
* Returns a String object representing the Todo.
* @return The String representation of the Todo.
* Returns a String object representing the Todo in a format that can be used to read and write
* @return The String representation of the Todo that be used to read and write from/to file.
* Ui class handles interactions with the user.
* Welcome message to the user upon startup of the program.
" What can I do for you?\n";
* Closing message to the user before exiting the program.
echo("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints the given input String enclosed between two horizontal lines.
